intro: Pedicularis moupinensis, commonly known as the Chinese lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes hemiparasitic plants that derive some of their nutrients from host plants. The species is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in alpine environments and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
